intro: Neobolusia, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce showy, often pink or white flowers. Neobolusia species are characterized by their milky latex, which can be toxic to some animals. They are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
